description.narrative: A key indicator of success will be the relative take up of the solutions and collective intelligence identified –either within policy, grafting onto UNDP programmes or through market means as independent ventures.

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: 1.1 Number of new data sources used at Country Office level. 1.2 Diversity of different data sources used 1.3 Number of sustainable development solutions identified and documented 1.4 Variety of innovation methods used to test and iterate over the different hypotheses. 2.1 Learning the Accelerator Lab Network shares with a public audience (outside of UNDP) 2.2 Number of lab insights, processes or products which are taken up by governments or other partners 2.3 Proportion of partners and governments that increase their take up of the innovation methods included in the Accelerator Lab Network suite 2.4 Proportion of UNDP Country Office programming influenced by the Accelerator Lab Network’s work and methodologies 3.1 Size and density of the network effects among the Accelerator Labs 3.2 Number of new models, approaches, and insights documented and disseminated throughout the network. 3.3 Engagement of the broader Development ecosystem with published learnings from the Accelerator Lab Network. 3.4 Amount of influence the learnings and methods of the Accelerator Lab Networks have on the discourse of the broader Development ecosystem.

comment.narrative: the Baseline for all below indicators is zero as per the results framework for the individual labs

5 new sources of data per year 6 different type of data sources per year 35 new potential solutions per lab per year 5 innovation methods per Action Plan At least 6 blogs, or other (substantial) media posts published per year. At least 50% of our learning challenges have the public sector or other partner as counterpart. At least one government entity or partner has adopted an accelerator lab method. At least 50% of our learning challenges are providing actionable knowledge to ongoing CO projects. The lab interacts at least once a week with another lab in the network. (48 interaction per year) 25% of information shared across the network should be methodology, or sustainable development issue and opportunity related. The Accelerator Lab Network´s work is featured at least 3 times per month in Country Office Social Media channels and tag UNDP Accelerator Labs accounts. The Lab team engages at least once a month across any social media conversation related to the work of the Accelerator Lab Network, from either personal or CO account Connect the Accelerator Lab’s publications to local development ecosystem through social media. Identify and engage with 5 new relevant local social media profiles of the broader Development Ecosystem

5 new sources of data 7 different type of data sources 27 new potential solutions per lab 5 innovation methods per Action Plan 8 blogs, and other (substantial) media posts published 100% of our learning challenges have the public sector / other partner as counterpart. No government entity or partner has adopted an accelerator lab method yet. None of our learning challenges provided actionable knowledge to ongoing CO projects yet. The lab interacted at least once a week with other labs in the network. (at least 52 interactions per year) 25% of information shared across the network was about methodology, or sustainable development issue and opportunity related. The Accelerator Lab Network´s work was featured 1-2 times per month in Country Office Social Media channels The Lab team engaged around once per quarter with social media conversation related to the work of the Accelerator Lab Network, from either personal or CO account The lab identified and engaged with more than 10 new relevant local social media profiles of the broader Development Ecosystem

2 new sources of data per year 3 different type of data sources per year 20 new potential solutions per lab per year 2 innovation methods per Action Plan 3 blogs, or other (substantial) media posts published per year. At least 50% of our learning challenges have the public sector or other partner as counterpart. At least one government entity or partner has learned about Accelerator lab methods. At least 50% of our learning challenges are providing actionable knowledge to ongoing CO projects. The lab interacts at least once a week with another lab in the network. (48 interaction per year) 5% of information shared across the network should be methodology, or sustainable development issue and opportunity related. The Accelerator Lab Network´s work is featured at least 2 times per month in Country Office Social Media channels and tag UNDP Accelerator Labs accounts. The Lab team engages at least once a month across any social media conversation related to the work of the Accelerator Lab Network, from either personal or CO account Connect the Accelerator Lab’s publications to local development ecosystem through social media. Identify and engage with 2 new relevant local social media profiles of the broader Development Ecosystem
None of the above targets were achieved as the Accelerator Lab in Jordan was officially launched in mid-December 2019.

10 new sources of data per year 9 different type of data sources per year 50 new potential solutions per lab per year 10 innovation methods per Action Plan At least 8 blogs, or other (substantial) media posts published per year. At least 50% of our learning challenges have the public sector or other partner as counterpart. At least one government entity or partner has learned about Accelerator lab methods. At least 50% of our learning challenges are providing actionable knowledge to ongoing CO projects. The lab interacts at least once a week with another lab in the network. (48 interaction per year) 50% of information shared across the network should be methodology, or sustainable development issue and opportunity related. The Accelerator Lab Network´s work is featured at least 3 times per month in Country Office Social Media channels and tag UNDP Accelerator Labs accounts. The Lab team engages at least once a month across any social media conversation related to the work of the Accelerator Lab Network, from either personal or CO account Connect the Accelerator Lab’s publications to local development ecosystem through social media. Identify and engage with 10 new relevant local social media profiles of the broader Development Ecosystem

No government entity or partner has adopted an accelerator lab method yet. 50% of our learning challenges provided actionable knowledge to ongoing CO projects yet. The lab interacted at least once a week with other labs in the network. (at least 52 interactions per year) More than 50% of information shared across the network was about methodology, or sustainable development issue and opportunity related. The Accelerator Lab Network´s work was featured 2-3 times per month in Country Office Social Media channels The Lab team engaged more than once per month with social media conversation related to the work of the Accelerator Lab Network, from either personal or CO account
